text: I was lying in bed and the window was
open and I could smell the smoke from my
boyfriend's cigarette wafting in it had
come to sort of symbolize that he wasn't
there in the bed with me when we first
been together we always went to bed
together but it seemed like it started
to become more of a ritual that he would
come to bed after I would it had been
about three months since we had moved to
New York we're both going through
adjustments to that and we just thought
we were going through a rough patch of
transition and we didn't realize that
some of that roughness wasn't pointing
to subside over time
and this particular night he walked in
the room and he said something really
weird just happened he'd heard a plop on
the canopy above him and then a bird had
slid down and on the ground near him
when we got out there we couldn't see
the pigeon anywhere and so I had to flip
on what we called the klieg lights which
were these really really bright lights
we could see the pigeon very clearly and
it seemed like it was on its last legs
this seemingly small incident felt like
this moment of unity we were acting
together and these tensions that sort of
fallen away because we were a team kind
of larger effort of saving this bird
when I woke up he told me the bird had
gotten well and escaped and when I went
outside there's no sign of it it seems
to have miraculously recovered and then
during the course of the day I started
to imagine he had hidden the body to
spare me the sadness of waking up and
finding this dead bird the idea that was
very difficult to relinquish I was
grasping for this moment of tenderness
this was actually a little over a year
before we broke up all of us look back
on all our relationships through the
darkest lens I do think there's real
value in remembering what was good about
it there are so many things if I could
go back that I would do differently but
ultimately I don't feel really
ship would have ended differently
you
